intro: Machaerina bidwellii, commonly known as Bidwell's machaerina, is a rare and endemic plant species native to California. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in chaparral habitats. It produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
